betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Welcome to §9§9§9§b§b§b§b§b§b§l§l§l§l§l§lSupersymmetry§r§r§r§r§r§r! 

You have just landed on an unfamiliar planet. This book will teach you how to rebuild civilization from scratch in only §k4200§r pages.

Start by getting a rock§r. This book is interactive.

When you pick up a rock from the ground, press the §l§l§l§l§l§l§a§a§a§a§a§aSUBMIT§r button to complete the quest and continue.

If you lose this book, you can check the quests by pressing the §2§aGRAVE §rkey.

Pages that have a normal icon aren't required for progression. 
Pages that have a framed icon, like this one are §crequired §rand contain critical information for your survival.


----------------------------------------
§3WELCOME TO SUPERSYMMETRY!
§r----------------------------------------
- Explore your surroundings
§r- Find shelter
- Prepare for the winter
- Acquire basic resources
- Try not to die
------------------------------------

It is probably impossible to try to play GregTech without using JEI. So here are some tips on how to use JEI to its full potential.

This pack will assume that the player's IQ is above 100. If you are confused, press §6R §ron an item in the questbook to see the item's crafting recipe, or §6U §rto see its uses.

§eBookmark items regularly§r (default key §aA§r) so you don't have to type the names over and over.

Most of the items have §emultiple recipes§r! Dont stop at the first recipe and think that item is impossible.
Sometimes a material is only available from §etiny dusts§r, sometimes it's available from a §efluid solution§r. It takes some practice. Oil processing and nuclear chemistry are pretty bad about this.

You can §epress @§r to see only items from that mod. For example, if you search for §c@gregtech§r, you will only see items from GregTech.

You can §epress $ §rto see only items from a specific entry in the Ore Dictionary. For example, if you search for §c$logWood§r, you will only see wooden logs.

You can §epress U §ron an item to see its uses.
betterquesting:10.name:8: It's JEI, not NEI. Use it wisely.

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
You are only able to grow some crops in certain seasons (but you can change that using a §agreenhouse§r, or with automated farming), and the environment around you will change throughout the year.

§aSpring §rstarts on March 1 and ends on May 30.
§6Summer §rstarts on June 1 and ends on August 30.
§cAutumn §rstarts on September 1 and ends on November 30.
§bWinter §rstarts on December 1 and ends on February 30.

Flint shards§r are needed to get yourself some tools. 

Gravel can be mined without a tool, and enables you to acquire flint.

Flint can be knapped [§aRight Click while looking at the top side of stone§r] on an exposed stone surface, obtaining flint shards.
The Akashic Tome is a compendium of several other guidebooks that might be useful for you. You can get it for free by clicking the checkbox.

Your new §eFlint Knife § can be used for cutting things,§f making things into shards, or getting §aplant fibers§r§..

To cut items other than blocks, you need to have the item you want to cut in your §0§aoffhand,§r and the knife in your §amain hand.§r This works vice versa.

You can also use the flint knife as a weapon.

You can use your shiny new §eflint knife§r to make plant fibers. 

You can get §aplant fibers§r by breaking §2tall grass §rwith your flint knife.
You can then pack those §aplant fibers§r into §aplant string§r.
Construct a §6Flint Hatchet§r using flint and plant fibers. As the name implies, it can cut down trees.
betterquesting:10.name:8: The part where you get wood

betterquesting:10.desc:8: You can use flint to develop new §6weapons§r. All you can make right now are a bow and an arrow, but they'll suffice for now.
Using our §6crafting table §ryou can now construct better tools, a §6flint pickaxe §rfor mining ores and a §6flint shovel §rfor digging sand or gravel.

There are many useful resources underground, so you should be looking around for them. 

Something you need to look for is §l§amagnetite§r. It will be used in the construction of magnets later.

Magnetite is found in ore deposits§a §runderground. Ore deposits are about 20 x 20 meters in size.

If you see a §atiny pile of magnetite §ron the surface, it will indicate that there is a deposit underground. 


Ore deposits can be found every 50 meters or so in each direction. If you are above an ore deposit, you will see metal rocks on the ground and an indicator on the top left of the screen.
Leather can be crafted into armor using a Crafting Table.

The furnace §ris a very primitive smelting device that allows you to cook things up to a temperature that is just enough to smelt copper, lead §rand §7tin§.§r.

§rMore information on finding these ores is on the next page.
For now you can just make the furnace.

Copper is found in §6Chalcopyrite, Chalcocite, Malachite, Bornite, Tetrahedrite, §ror §6Copper Ore§r deposits. Copper can be found pretty much everywhere in the Earth's crust, and even in the deeper layers.

If you are having trouble finding a specific deposit, look it up in the JEI database, you will find a page showing where it is found. 

Let's start by getting 20 copper ingots.

Finding a §6Tiny Pile of Copper Dust §ron the ground means that there is a deposit under it.

Tin can be found in §6Cassiterite Sand§r, §6Cassiterite Ore§r§r§r, §rand §6Tin Ore§r deposits. You can look them up in the JEI database to see where you can find them.

Tin is a silvery-coloured metal. Tin is soft enough to be cut with little force and a bar of tin can be bent with little effort. 
§6
§l§rOre deposits cover a surface of 20 by 20 meters across. Each deposit can contain up to 5,000 ingots worth of ore.
The §amortar§r§r can be used for crushing ores and ingots into §bdusts§r. You can use stone and flint to make it.

§6Bronze§r is an alloy consisting of 75% copper combined with about 25% tin.

Mix the dusts in a §acrafting table§r in a 3 to 1 ratio to make §6bronze dust§r. Then you must smelt it in a furnace to get bronze ingots.

Crafting the dusts by hand will only yield 3 §6bronze dust§r per batch. However, you can craft 4 with the same amount later on using a §6Mixer§f.

§3This will unlock Tier 1.

Nights are dark and extremely dangerous on most planets known to support life, seek shelter as soon as possible.

If you go outside, you may notice that there are several entities around you. At this stage you are nowhere near ready for killing any of them, so§cyou must hide. §r

A grindstone can be used for extracting more dust out of your ores. It's not that good... but it's a start. It's also §cmanual§r, so you have to power it using your hands.

Put a §6Wooden Crank §ron the grindstone and §aright click §ron it to rotate it. After a few seconds, the ore will have turned into dust.

Putting 1 ore in results in an output of 2 dusts. 

§cThe quartz grindstone at the moment does not have compatibility. This will be patched (eventually)
Breaking leaves§r with a piece of Flint§r or a Flint Knife will drop a stick. However, Flint Shards will not work.

The §7Coke Oven §ris a hollow 3x3x3 structure made of Coke Bricks with a Coke Oven Controller in the center.
It turns §7Coal §rinto §7Coal Coke§r, and Logs into Charcoal.

Coal Coke burns longer in furnaces, and in small coal boilers. 

§3

§rMore advanced tools will be needed to progress towards the Industrial Age. There are six major types of tools.

The §2hammer §ris used kind of everywhere. It's used to make all the other tools and it turns ingots into plates
The §2file§r turns ingots into rods.
The §2saw §rturns wood planks into slabs, and turns logs into 4 planks. Finally!
The §2screwdriver§r is used in most recipes and in setting up covers. It also makes important parts like gears and rotors.
The §2wrench§r is used in cutting pipes and it's probably the most important tools out of all of them.
The §2wire cutter§r cuts wiring.

§l§c§lBoth JEI and the book will show iron tools wherever tools are used. Tools other than iron will not show up in the JEI search. Bronze tools exist and should be made first. Generally, recipes accept all kinds of tools.§r

A furnace is not really good for smelting items. Its maximum temperature is only 1000 K (730°C), which is not hot enough for iron.

A Primitive Blast Furnace is made out of 32 §cFirebricks§r and 1 §4Primitive Blast Furnace Controller§r. It's a  §a3x4x3 structure§r§r of firebricks that is hollowed out in the middle. For more help, look at the §cStructure Preview§r in the JEI database.

The Primitive Blast Furnace can smelt iron, wrought iron and §bsteel§r. It has a maximum temperature of about 1400 K (1,127°C).

Like many other structures, it is possible to share the walls of multiple Primitive Blast Furnaces and they will still work.

§7Sphalerite §rveins contain §7sphalerite ore§r, an important source of zinc. It's found on Earth at altitude 0 to 60, but also in the deepest part of the crust.

Zinc is a slightly brittle metal at room temperature and has a shiny-greyish appearance.

Zinc will be used to create magnets, but if you can't find zinc, §amagnetite ore §rcan be used instead.

To make magnets, you must have a §bVoltaic Pile§r. §c
§r
A Voltaic Pile is made of three components: a §6Copper Plate§r, a §7Zinc Plate§r, and Electrolyte Paper.

A common electrolyte is §6citric acid§r. Putting lemons, limes, or oranges with paper will create electrolyte paper. Limes can be found in jungles, lemons can be found in jungle edges and forests, while oranges can be found in savannah biomes. 

If you can't get a hold of a voltaic pile, you can use another method for magnetizing an iron rod, using §6magnetite§r.

§7Iron §ris the most common element on planet Earth. It is used for refining it into §6steel§r [see the next page] and for basic tools. It is one of the most important metals of the Industrial Age.

Extracting usable metal from iron ores requires kilns or furnaces (such as a §cBlast Furnace§r) capable of reaching 1,500 °C (1,773K) or higher, about 500 °C higher than that required to smelt copper.

To start, you will need an §ciron rod§r - make an ingot of iron into a rod (with the file), then put it in a furnace.

There are two ways of making magnets:

- Putting a hot iron rod with a §cmagnetite chunk§r in a crafting table, 
- or using the §cvoltaic pile §ralong with some §ccopper fine wire§r (you need special equipment though).§ 

This process is only done once§r. A newly-formed §cmagnetic iron rod § can be used to magnetise other hot iron rods so don't throw it out!

§3This will unlock the Industrial Age.
§7Magnetite §rores can be broken up into §7magnetite chunks§r by using a Crafting Table. They can be used to magnetize an §6iron rod§r.

We can make better tools out of §6bronze§r. You need to make the tool parts first, and then assemble the tool.

The bronze axe can cut down entire trees with just one click.

The bronze mining hammer can mine an entire 3x3 meter area with one click, unless you're pressing §aSHIFT§r.

The bronze spade does the same thing as the mining hammer, except it works with blocks which work with shovels, such as dirt and sand.

§c§lBoth JEI and the book will show iron tools wherever tools are used. Tools other than iron will not show up in the JEI search. Bronze tools exist and should be made first. Generally, recipes accept all kinds of tools.§r
Use your new alloy to make a §6bronze sword§r.

§6Steel§r is an alloy of iron and carbon with §6improved strength§r and fracture resistance compared to other forms of iron.

A §cPrimitive Blast Furnace §rcan turn iron ingots into §l§esteel§r, by smelting them with coal coke. 

Making steel is one of the top priorities of the Industrial Age. Make sure to have your Primitive Blast Furnace running at all times, or try to make 4 Primitive Blast Furnaces sharing their walls.

The goals for the Industrial Age is to obtain steam machines, making vacuum tubes and getting electricity.

The following information will be critical to your survival, so read it carefully!


§l§nHow do I get steam?§r

There are different ways to produce steam, there is the §c§cCoal Boiler§r,§c Lava Boiler§r, the §cSolar Boiler§r, and the §cLarge Boilers§r. A good option right now is the Coal Boiler.

The Coal Boiler is powered by §cfurnace fuels§r and is extremely fuel efficient. It will take some time to heat up, and once hot enough it will §c§rconsume water§r and §c§rautomatically output steam§r into connected pipes. Remember that boilers can §4§l§nexplode§r when they're already hot, have no water and you add some water.

§l§nHow do Steam machines work?§r

§n§l§rSteam machines are §6slow§r, §6need pipe connection§r, and §6do not auto-output§r.
They also have an §6exhaust vent§r, represented by a gray square on their backside by default. 
This vent can be moved using a wrench, but §6must remain unblocked§r. 
When a recipe is completed, the vent will start shooting steam particles in the air, and if you're standing near the vent, you will be §c§lboiled alive

§l§nI'm still confused!
§rWatch this video if you need some help: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CR3KGYtaEtM

§r------------------------------------
§3CHAPTER 1 - STARTING A REVOLUTION
§r------------------------------------
§r- Industrialize
- Use the power of steam
- Start producing electricity
- Create the most basic electronics

Tier : 1 
EU/t : 0 
------------------------------------

The §l§rSteam Alloy Smelter §rdirectly combines dusts or ingots into §c§lnew alloys.

§rThis machine requires a fair amount of steam to work. If it ever runs out of steam, the machine can be turned off with a §aSoft Hammer§r.

The §6Alloy Smelter§r can make bronze directly, using §dingots§o§o§r, dusts, or even nuggets.§r You can make a nugget mold as well to turn ingots into nuggets. 

NOTE: Like all steam machines, the output port doubles as a steam outlet when recipes complete. §cIt must not be blocked§r. Also, steam is hot and can damage you if touched. Change the output side by whacking the Alloy Smelter with a wrench.

The §6Steam Macerator §ris used to convert ores into crushed ores. This is the most simple way of doing ore processing.

Every ore put into the Steam Macerator turns into 2 crushed ores, that can be smelted in the Furnace or PBFto get two ingots.

§6Molds§o§r can be used in the alloy smelter and the fluid solidifier. You need them to make vacuum tubes.
They can be used for turning dusts into ingots, or ingots into gears, using the alloy smelter.§r

The creation of §6Rubber §ris a very important step for any aspiring technician. Later on, rubber allows you to create circuitry.
Rubber is made from §5§6Latex§r, a fluid which is collected by putting a §6Steam Latex Collector §rnear a Rubber Tree. 

Make sure that the Collector is touching a Rubber Log on the §6white §rside of the machine.

The §7LV Conveyor Module §ris the fourth machine component you will need. 

It can be also used as a cover to move items around. 

The Conveyor Module, when placed on a machine, will transfer items to the block adjacent to the face it’s on. You can configure it to import or export items from the machine or item pipe you place it on.

Voltages are irrelevant when placing covers on machines, so, for example, you can safely put an LV conveyor module on HV machines and vice versa.

§d§rNickel is a silvery-white lustrous metal with a slight golden tinge. It is a hard and ductile transition metal. 

§e§dNickel§r is found in §6Garnierite§r, §6Pentlandite§r, §6§rand §6Nickel §rores. They are found in the second layer of Earth's crust, called "The Beneath" by villagers.

Mining deeper in the crust requires special equipment. Check the Exploration chapter for more info.
 §r
Nickel will be required for the production of §6electricity§r.

The §6Steam Roaster §rburns chemicals using steam. It's a reaction furnace. This machine will be used for the production of §6sulfur§r. The Roaster will be used in many chemical processes in LV and onwards.
The §aSteam Compressor §rcompresses things. It can turn ingots into blocks, as well as nuggets to ingots.

The §l§r§6Steam Forge Hammer §ris an extremely useful machine that will do pretty much anything that requires a hammer.

§r§r§r§l§rIt can make §6plates §r§l§rat a better ratio, only requiring 1.5 ingots instead of 2 per plate.
The §6Vulcanizing Press§r turns Latex into Rubber plates. It requires §6Sulfur§r. The reaction may take a long time but it can be sped up by using §6Magnesia §ror §6Zincite§r as a catalyst.

§cRed Alloy§r is a highly conductive alloy made out of redstone and §ecopper§r. It can only be made in the alloy smelter.

You can find §4Redstone Ore §rin the overworld, at Y levels 15 to 35. If you find redstone rocks on the surface, this means that there will be a deposit underground. Let's get digging!

Congratulations, [INSERT PLAYER NAME HERE]! You made it past the easy part. Now it's time for the hard part.  

As I said in the beginning quest, the main objective of the Industrial Age is §evacuum tubes§r, which are kind of complicated and confusing to set up.
Our first step is making §aglass tubes§r, with a ball mold and glass dust.

§6Pyrite §rcan be obtained by digging in §6Galena §ror §6Sphalerite §rdeposits, found in the first two layers of the crust.

Pyrite §6dust §rcan be roasted to obtain Banded Iron dust and elemental §6Sulfur§r, which will be used in processing rubber.
Banded Iron can be roasted again to obtain §6Sulfur Trioxide§r.
The §7§6Steam Mixer §rmixes several dusts or fluids together. It will be required for mixing Sulfur Trioxide and Water to create H2SO4.

Sulfur Trioxide and Water can be mixed together to create §6Sulfuric Acid§r.

SO3 + H2O -> H2SO4

Since §6Sulfuric Acid §ris an acid, it will require §6special equipment §rto handle it. §c§lBuckets or Bronze/Steel Drums can't handle Acids. §rYou must use a §c§lLead Drum §rto transport Sulfuric Acid, as it's acid-proof.
The §7LV Bending Machine §ris a better method for making Plates and Foils. It processes §61 Ingot into 1 Plate§r, unlike the Steam Forge Hammer which processed 3 Ingots into 2 Plates.
Use the Vulcanizing Press to create §6Rubber Sheets.

The§6 Coagulation Tank§r is a hollow, 3x3x3 cubic structure that coagulates fluids into solids.

The Coagulation Tank requires:
§6- 1 Coagulation Tank Controller
- 24 Wooden Coagulation Tank Wall
§r
The tank can coagulate liquid Latex into a solid hunk of Latex. 
Some fluid §6Catalysts§r can be used to make the process faster, but it requires that Circuits are supplied to the machine, so this isn't available right now. 

While this isn't strictly required, it makes the next step of the Rubber processing chain about §c8x more efficient§r.

§6Wires §rcan be insulated with §6Rubber §sto create Cables. Cables don't have a lot of §6Energy Loss§r, and, unlike wires, you won't get damaged if you touch them.
These will be required in the creation of circuits.

§6LV Electric Motors §rare one of the most important components in electric machines, but they are also required to make §6pistons§r.

While you'll only need a few of these in the Industrial Age, once you get to the Electric Age you will require hundreds of pistons. You can batch craft 16 or more Pistons at a time to reduce the pain.
The §6LV Electric Piston§r is also another important component of electric machines, but it will be required to make the Steam Macerator and Forge Hammer.
Combining a plate of §6Lead §rwith some wiring creates §6Lead Anodes and Cathodes§r. If they are combined with §6Sulfuric Acid§r, they can make a Lead Acid Battery.

A §6Vacuum Tube §o§ris a device that controls electric current flow in a high vacuum between electrodes. It's basically one of the components for the §6Primitive Circuit.§r

Combine all the items to make a Vacuum Tube.

Macerating is still an ore doubler like in other mods, but there is a twist, it does not give dusts directly! Crushed Ores are meant for more advanced ore processing. One Crushed Ore will convert to one dust.

To get the Impure Dust§r, hammer the Crushed Ore. 

This is done either by using a Hammer tool in the crafting table, or using the Steam Forge Hammer.

The Impure Dust can be smelted in the Furnace to get the Ingot, however mixed ores (Limonite, Chalcopyrite) will only give nuggets over ingots.

The Impure Dust can also be thrown in a vanilla Cauldron filled with water to clean it and turn it into a regular dust. Throw them in full stacks to consume less water per single dust.

§lNote: Macerating, hammering, and then smelting (sometimes into nuggets) is really time consuming in the steam age! Resource efficiency can be ignored for now. Nobody will blame you for smelting ores directly into ingots.

§2High pressure §rsteam machines require steel and they're two times faster than normal steam machines. High pressure §r§eboilers§r also generate steam twice as fast. Contrary to their name, they do not require actual High Pressure.
Lava can also be used to boil steam.

§6Solar boilers §rcan be used to get steam using the power of the sun. 
They only generate steam while the sun is up, 13 hours per day.
§6Bronze Drums §rdon't occupy much space, but they can store up to 32,000 L of fluid in a single block.
The §7LV Wiremill §ris a machine that processes §61 Ingot §rinto §62 Wires§r automatically. It can also process a Wire into §64 Fine Wires§r. It is §cmuch more efficient §rthan making wires manually.
In the Industrial Age you are able to produce better weapons. The §aHandcannon §ris one of those. It uses stone bullets as ammunition.

The §aDouble Barrel Shotgun§r is the first ever gun that you can make. It uses §aShotgun Rounds §o§rfor ammo.

It's a shotgun, this means it will fire 8 projectiles at once. For more info, look at the tooltip.
The §Trevolver uses §6Pistol Rounds §rfor ammo.

A §6Resistor§r is an electrical component that limits the flow of electrical current in an electronic circuit.

Resistors are another major component of §bLV circuits§r. They are made with sticky resin, which can be found on §2rubber trees§.. Use a §6Treetap §rto extract the resin.

§6Coated circuit boards§r are another component of LV circuits. They are made with sticky resin, and wood planks. A circuit board is used in electronic engineering to connect electronic components to one another.

You have to coat the board with wires to make it usable, turning it into a §6Basic Circuit Board§r.

Assembling the circuit parts (§6resistors§r, §bvacuum tubes§r, §cwiring§r, and the §2board§r) gets you one Primitive Circuit. 

Circuits are the brain of all electric machines - they're needed for the machine to work. There are over 10 different types of circuits - ranging from Primitive to extremely powerful bio-processors.

-- §aIMPORTANT INFORMATION§r --
- Surface gravity: 1g
- Day length: 24 hours 
- Atmosphere: Breathable (1 atm)
    1. 78.084% Nitrogen
    2. 20.946% Oxygen
    3. 0.9340% Argon
    4. 0.0417% Carbon Dioxide
    5. 0.001818% Neon
    6. 0.000524% Helium
    7. 0.000187% Methane
    8. 0.000114% Krypton
- Orbital period: 360 Days 
- Satellites:
    1. Moon
-------------------------


§aEarth§r is a terrestrial planet that orbits a star called §6the Sun§r. It has a rocky surface that is divided into various landforms known as continents. It includes vast oceans, towering mountains, lush forests, arid deserts, and polar ice caps.

From a distance, Earth appears to be a blue and green orb due to the presence of water and vegetation on its surface. The oceans cover approximately 70% of the planet's surface, while the remaining 30% is made up of land.

The mountains on Earth are towering structures that rise up from the planet's surface and can reach incredible heights. Forests on Earth are abundant and provide a home for many different species of plants and animals. These forests are a vital component of the planet's ecosystem and play an essential role in regulating the Earth's climate. Deserts are dry and arid regions where very little rainfall occurs. Large §6salt flats §rcan be found in the desert.

§cBy digging down from the Earth's surface, one can encounter three types of rocks: Sedimentary, Igneous and Metamorphic. Sedimentary rocks, like limestone, can be found at altitude levels up to 40, while igneous rocks, like gabbro or granite, can be found between 0 and 40.

Under the Earth there is a cave system called The Beneath. This cave system is a complex network of underground tunnels, chambers, and passageways that stretches over a significant distance. You can get to it by digging down to Y level 0.

-- §aIMPORTANT INFORMATION§r --

Planet: §aEarth§r
ID: §a10§r
Depth: §c64m§r
-------------------------
§4Dig 64 meters from sea level to access the second layer. Please be aware while traversing The Beneath, as it is very dangerous.

§rThe Beneath refers to the deep, subterranean layers of the Earth's crust. These layers are composed of metamorphic rock. 

The rocks found in The Beneath are formed from the intense pressure and heat that are present deep within the Earth's crust. Within The Beneath, you can find ores that have been hidden for millions of years. For example: §6anthracite§r, a rare type of coal.

Exploring The Beneath requires specialized equipment and expertise. Several §b§kWeeping Angels §r can also be found in the Beneath. They are extremely dangerous entities, so be extremely careful while exploring.

-- §aIMPORTANT INFORMATION§r --

Planet: §aEarth§r
ID: §a-1§r
Depth: §c320m§r
-------------------------
§4Dig down to the bottom of the Beneath to access this dimension.§r

§3§4§lWARNING: Water buckets do not work at high temperatures. Tanks may be used to transport fluid here instead.

-- §aIMPORTANT INFORMATION§r --

- Surface gravity: 0.166g

- Day length: 30 Earth days

- Atmosphere: None

- Orbital period: 30 Earth days

- Orbits: Earth

- Satellites: None

-------------------------

§3WARNING: Due to technical restrictions, your internal clock will not work while on the Moon.

The §6lead–acid battery§r is the first type of rechargeable battery ever created. Compared to more powerful batteries, lead–acid batteries have relatively low energy density. But it's a start.

Combining Cathodes, Anodes, and a Mogus

§6Antimony §ris a semi-metal. In its metallic form it is silvery, hard and brittle. Antimony is used to make §6battery alloy§r, which is used to make the casings for §6batteries§r.

Antimony is found in §6Stibnite Ore§r, in the same deposit as §6Redstone §rand §6Cinnabar§r.
§6§rCombine §6Lead §rand §5§6Antimony §rdusts in a Steam Mixer to create Battery Alloy.

§6Quicklime§r, or calcium oxide, can be obtained by smelting limestone in a Furnace. Limestone can be found by mining underground. 

§6Quicklime §rcan be turned into §6Slaked Lime §rusing a water bucket. Since iron buckets aren't available now, you can check the Clay Buckets page for more info. It will be used for the construction of firebricks.
§6Pistons §rare required to build most of your Steam machines, so it's important that you get a few of them.

§cThese should be your priorities for the first few days:

§r- Get gravel
- Get sticky resin
- Get an axe
- Chop a ton of wood
- Make a shelter over a Copper or Tin vein
- Get seeds from grass 
- Set up an indoor crop farm

There should also be some food rations which came in the drop pod. These should be enough to last a few days.

Combining a bunch of §6wires §rand a §6steel ring §rcreates the components for a §6Vacuum Tube§r. These will be put into a glass tube and sealed shut at an extremely low pressure using a §6Vacuum Chamber§r. For now, just make the components.

A §6vacuum chamber§r is a rigid enclosure from which air and other gases are removed by a vacuum pump.

This results in extremely low pressures, for example, the Vacuum Tube requires less than 130 §6§lmicro§l§r§6Pascals §rto function.

This is required to make the Vacuum Tube.

§6Wires §rcan be cut from a plate of metal using a §6Wire Cutter§r.

If you have to make §6Fine Wires§r instead, you have to first turn a Plate of metal into a §6Foil§r, and then use the wire cutter.

Before establishing a railroad empire, it's a good idea to ensure a robust supply of Steel, Treated Wood, and electrical power.

Create a §b§bLarge Wrench§r, and a §bTrack Blueprint§r. These tools are essential to progress and construct trains.

The §bCasting Basin§r creates different parts for rolling stock, specifically wheels and frames, as well as the Rail Cast for use with the Track Roller. The Gauge selector changes between gauges.

§rThe Casting Basin requires:

114 Stone Bricks
15 Heavy Engineering Block
126 Sand
86 Blast Brick

Make sure to understand GregTech energy before continuing.
§r

Energy consists of §6Voltage§r and §6Amperage§r. Think of amps as being energy packets that are sent from the generator.
A Low Voltage generator will output §632 EU/t§r (that's the voltage) in §61 amp§r.
If you have four generators they will output §632 volts in 4 amps§r together. 
32 volts in 4 amps is not the same thing as MV (Medium Voltage - 128 volts per amp)
This can be compared to four cables containing 32 volts each or one 4x Cable.

===============================

Let's talk about §4explosions§r.
There are multiple ways GT Electric machines can explode. 

§9Rain§r will make your electric machines explode if the rain hits the machine, so put your machinery under a proper roof§r. Wires without insulation will catch fire when they touch rain.
§c§r§4Fire§r will explode your machines if it gets too close.

§6If you give your machines too high voltage they will explode.§r 
To avoid making this error, I suggest that you make some space between different tiers of machines. 

You should also use different cables for different tiers to avoid mistakes. 
This means §ldo NOT use MV cables for LV energy§r§r, but it will be a while before we can get to that.

Combining §6Slaked Lime§r, §7Flint Dust§r, §6Sand Dust§r and §7Clay Balls (dusts can be made using a Mortar) will create §6Fireclay Mix§r.

Fireclay Mix can be turned into Compressed Fireclay by using a brick form.

§6Compressed Fireclay §rmust be smelted in a Furnace to turn it into §6Firebricks§r.

Firebricks need to be crafted into blocks to be used in the construction of a Blast Furnace. 32 Firebricks are required for a Primitive Blast Furnace.
The §6LV Polarizer §rmagnetizes substances without the use of a Voltaic Pile. For example, it can turn a normal Iron Rod into a Magnetic Iron Rod.

The §6Mixer §rcombines different fluids, and it also combines different dusts that can't be combined by hand. The §6Mixer§r is required in creating most alloys and in some chemical chains. It is also used to make §6concrete§r.

The §6Continuous Stirred Tank Reactor §ris a type of chemical reactor. There are several types of chemical reactors, and each one will be used for a different type of reaction.

The §6CSTR §rdoes continuous reactions between §6fluids §rand §6gases§r. Continuous processes involve two fluids or gases slowly reacting with each other. This is why it reacts only 10L of fluid every half a second or so instead of doing 1,000 L at once.

The §6Trickle Bed Reactor §ris a type of chemical reactor. 

The §6Trickle Bed Reactor §rdoes continuous reactions between §6fluids §rinvolving a §6catalyst§r that can only be in dust form. It does §6continuous §rprocesses, just like the CSTR.

The § §6Bubble Column Reactor §ris a type of chemical reactor. 

The §6Bubble Column Reactor §rdoes reactions that involve bubbling a §6gas §rinto another fluid. It does §6continuous §rprocesses, just like the CSTR.

The §6Fixed Bed Reactor §ris another type of chemical reactor.

It does reactions that involve §6a catalyst tray§r. Unlike the Trickle Bed Reactor, the catalyst has to be put in a tray instead of just using a dust. The FBR does continuous processes.
The §6Crystallizer §ris a machine that is required to crystallize large quantities of §bFluids §rinto solids.
§6Electrolysis§r is a stage in the separation of elements from naturally occurring sources, such as ores using an §6Electrolyzer§r.
The §6Gas Collector §rcollects §bair §rfrom the environment. Air can be used in §6sintering§r and it also can be separated into §bnitrogen §rand §boxygen §rusing §bcryogenic distillation.

Combining §6Mud Balls§r, a §6Pile of Sand§r, §6Clay Dust §rand §aStraw§r (obtained from Plant Fibers) will create §6Mudbrick Mix§
.

Mudbricks are §6not required §rfor progressing to the Industrial Age, however they can be used for constructing a §6Primitive Baking Oven§r.

Compressing §5§6Mudbrick Mix§r using a Brick Form creates Mud Bricks. Smelting them in a Furnace creates §6Adobe Bricks§r.

Adobe Bricks need to be combined into blocks to be used in construction.

§6Building Wands §rare wands that build surfaces for you. There are 4 main types of wands:

The §dUnbreakable Building Wand §rcan place an inventory's worth of blocks at a time, and never breaks.

Circuits are defined by two characteristics: their §6technological level§r (electronic, quantum, optical, etc,) and their "rank" in a given §6technology tier§r (assembly, mainframe, etc.)

These two characteristics give a circuit its name and voltage tier (e.g. the Micro Computer, an EV circuit and the 3rd micro circuit.)

The first technological tier of circuits, primitive circuits, is crafted by hand. The following tiers are fabricated in Circuit Assemblers, or the Assembly Line for high-end assemblies, computers and mainframes. 

Higher technological tiers demand more complex processing chains for their respective components, but generally follow similar patterns in terms of what components they require (SMDs, circuit boards, metal frames for mainframes, etc.) 

Technological advancement will also allow you to make previous circuits more efficiently (e.g. using SoCs to craft Refined Processors without through-hole/SMD components.)
